result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J Wirth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs) [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs totalling $443.00 have been paid in full, forfeiting the cash bond on file.  Balance of cash bond ($57.00) will be applied to 2016CM221.

Consecutive to any other sentence.  To commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit.  On December 6, 2016 Court amends JOC to reflect 6 days of sentence credit.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas J Wirth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: and Order to Amend Judgment of Conviction
Releasing Funds - $443.00 to COC on 2016CM63 & $57.00 to COC on 2016CM221

10:24 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - matters are resolved.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to Count 1 in 2016CM63 as repeater and counts 1,4 & 6 in 2016CM221 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in and repeaters will be dismissed.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged in 2016CM63 and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1,4 & 6, striking the repeaters in 2016CM221 and orders count 2 be dismissed outright and count 3 & 5 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CM63 (Count 1)

-15 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

2016CM221 (count 1)

-23 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-$400 fine plus court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw Fee - $42.50
-DL revocation - 13 months
-IID - 13 months
-AODA(Outagamie)
-DNA sample

Count 4

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

Count 6

-7 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence.  With huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit on 2016CM63.  
Court grants the defendant 12 hours of sentence credit on count 1 in 2016CM221.

Court adjourned at 10:39 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:55 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - waiting on Discovery on 2016CM221 but have offers in both cases.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 14, 2016 at 10:0 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:56 a.m.

Called Atty Joey Roeth - 2016CM221 is scheduled for 10/10 at 11:00 a.m.  This case should have been scheduled for the same date and time.  No objection by Atty Roeth to having it on 10/10 at 11:00 a.m.
43
Status hearing on October 11, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:19 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - defendant has a new case with a status on October 10, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.  Court sets for Status on that court date. 

Court adjourned at 11:20 a.m.
Attorney Joey Roeth
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.

1:51 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 13, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.. 

Court adjourned at 1:52 p.m.

Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

10:10 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - this is a fairly new case, have requested Discovery.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.
Status hearing on June 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
By Atty Barb Privat
Original Warrant has been received and destroyed

Per Dawn at the PD's office, defendant qualifies and counsel will be appointed.  Notified defendant that he does not need to appear.
43

Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Sue at GLSO.
43
Bond Payments / Check #8098
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement
Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Status hearing on May 17, 2016 at 09:15 am.
Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:04 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court goes over message received from the Public Defender's office.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  DA makes recites offer - recommends jail time on count 1 and dismiss count 2.  Statement by the defendant.  Court determines the defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500 cash and conditions of:  Defendant is not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 17, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:09 p.m.

Warrant sent down to GLSO on 03/29/2016.
43
Warrant letter sent to the defendant - respond on or before March 14, 2016 or warrant will be issed.

10:09 a.m.  No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.

Court adjourned at 10:09 a.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
